Articles.Content:
This is a challenge for the highest altitude you can get to, using only RCS!

Rules

- no propulsion other than RCS (or decouplers)

- no wings or control surfaces

- no mods except info/pilot mods like Mechjeb

Scoring is by highest altitude achieved.

Submit a screenshot of the vehicle on the pad/runway, and another of it at the highest altitude.

Here's mine to start it off - 10,022 meters.

On the pad

At highest altitude

After about an hour, i couldnt figure out a way to get close to your attempt, even with a design looking pretty much the same as yours i couldnt get over 3km. But while figuring out a way to keep this thing on course (so much rcs overreacts pretty much) i got an Idea.

I present the "RCS-Wheel":

It works ok, but im working on a more stable version that wont tip over by adding one more of those to each side on the on on the picture.

Haha nice Jaedinator. Monopropellant doesn't transfer with fuel lines, so I had to transfer fuel during the flight from the bottom to the top. I can't figure out how to only use monopropellant from one stage at a time.

No decouplers?

You can use decouplers.

you can click on the resource bar and then on RCS fuel, that way all RCS tank have their UI visible and you can disable/reable the fuel flow and activate the next Tank when you decoupler the first etc.

Well since not many people attempted it, I gave it another try: 26,657 m. At about 500 parts it's about at the limit of what my computer can handle. I used Jaedinator's advice and disabled fuel flow for all tanks except the bottom one, and re-enabled one tank at a time when staging.

The thing about RCS is that it gets much more efficient above a thousand meters or so, from 100 Isp sea level to 250 Isp vacuum. So maybe someone with a better computer and more patience can get an RCS-powered craft to orbit!
Dang... Now I wanna attempt to go to the mun on only RCS...
